column4: now, anyone know what in the boot process is hogging my sdb, it wont let me mount anything on it after boot
but if i stop it at the ramdisk its all good
lsof /dev/sdb and /dev/sdb* shows nothing
but anything from hda will work at the same mountpoint
and it all works ok from the initrd
only after a system boot it goes silly
say what?
what you can mount hdc but not hdd, hde, etc?
after ubuntu boots it thinks all my drives except the boot drive are busy
it sounds like you messed up your fstab theoddbot
nope, fresh as a daisy
so, it boots fine, you can mount partitions fine, but you cannot mount the slave?
dd-ing my boot partition to another drive to see if anything changes
yeah, even if i put fstab entries in it wont mount them
are you sure the slave is okay?
sometimes the drive is hosed
theres 4 drives in the system, and they are fine
i can badblocks and e2fsk them etc
i would reverse the drives and install ubuntu on the slave (now master) and see what happens in reverse
yeah trying that now
though like i said, if i break the boot parameters so that it stops on the initrd, before anything is mounted proper, it all works ok
any way i can boot the system step-by-step till i find out whats causing it
not without rewriting the bootscripts ... not that i know of in other words
